付.definition: to pay; to hand over to; classifier for pairs or sets of things

付之一嘆.definition: to dismiss with a sigh (idiom); a hopeless case

付之一歎.definition: to dismiss with a sigh (idiom); a hopeless case

付之一炬.definition: to put to the torch (idiom); to commit to the flames; to burn sth down deliberately

付之一笑.definition: (idiom) to dismiss sth with a laugh; to laugh it off

付之度外.definition: to think nothing of doing sth (idiom); to do sth without considering the risks; to leave out of consideration

付之東流.definition: to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably

付之行動.definition: to put into action; to transform into acts

付出.definition: to pay; to expend; to invest (energy or time)

付印.definition: to go to press; to submit for printing

付方.definition: credit side (of a balance sheet), as opposed to 收方[shou1 fang1]

付梓.definition: (literary) to send (a manuscript) to the press

付款.definition: to pay a sum of money; payment

付清.definition: to pay in full; to pay all of a bill; to pay off

付諸.definition: to apply to; to put into (practice etc); to put to (a test, a vote etc)

付諸實施.definition: to put into practice; to carry out (idiom)

付費.definition: to pay; to cover the costs
